author: Special Correspondent
text:
Personal enmity suspected to be reason for the murder

BRUTAL ATTACK:Commissioner of Police Shailesh Kumar Yadav inspecting the spot where AIADMK councillor K. Vijayaraghavan was hacked to death on Munichalai Road in Madurai on Sunday.— Photo: G. Moorthy

An armed gang attacked a Madurai Corporation councillor, K. Vijayaraghavan (47) of Ismailpuram, to death at Munichalai on Sunday night.

The deceased, representing Ward 51 of the Corporation, was also the ward secretary of the All India Anna Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam (AIADMK). Police said that Vijayaraghavan, along with two others, was sitting in front of an electrical shop in the locality when an armed gang hacked him around 8 p.m. In the attack, he suffered multiple injuries on his head.

He was rushed to a private hospital immediately, from where he was referred to Government Rajaji Hospital. However, he died on the way.

Commissioner of Police Shailesh Kumar Yadav, who inspected the scene of crime on the busy road, said that the grave crime appeared to be no way related to political rivalry. It looked like the result of personal enmity. Special police teams have been formed to nab the accused.

As the news spread, a large number of party men thronged the hospital. A large posse of police was deployed in and around the premises on Panagal Road to prevent any untoward incident.
title: AIADMK councillor hacked to death
